citation.article-title: Thermococcus litoralis sp. nov.: A new species of extremely thermophilic marine archaebacteria.

p.s: Description of Thermococcus litoralis sp. nov.
Thermococcus litoralis (li. to. ra'lis L. adj. litoralis, pertaining to the shore)
Cells are regular to irregular about 0.5 - 3.0 μm in diameter, mostly occurring singly, sometimes in pairs.
Cells are not flagellated in contrast to Thermococcus celer.
They grow obligately heterotrophically on yeast extract, peptone, meat extract, casein and tryptone and are able to reduce sulfur.

Cells are extreme thermophiles growing between 55 and 98°C with an optimum around 85°C (Thermococcus celer, upper growth limit at 93°C), between pH 4.0 and 8.0 with the optimum at pH 6 and between 1.8-6.5% NaCl.

G + C content of DNA is about 38 mol% (Pyrococcus furiosus, 38 mol%, Thermococcus celer, 56.6 mol%); no significant DNA-DNA homology with Thermococcus celer and Pyrococcusfuriosus. 300 sequenced bases of the 16S rRNA of Thermococcus celer and strain NS-C were identical [three priming sites used: (1) position 1338-1355, (2) position 1039-1053, (3) position 829- 847].
Isolated from shallow submarine solfataras at Lucrino/Naples and Porto di Levante/Vulcano.
Strain A3 is also deposited at the Deutsche Sammlung für Mikroorganismen as DSM 5474.
